title: China's June coal output rises to six-month high on summer demand
content:
Skip to comments.
Posted on 07/18/2024 7:12:22 AM PDT by george76
China's coal output rose to a six-month high in June, statistics bureau data showed on Monday, as mines ramped up production to meet seasonal demand ... The world's largest coal producer mined 405.38 million metric tons of the fuel last month, a 3.6% increase on the year and the highest since December ... Output will continue rising in the third quarter ... Output in the January-June period was 2.27 billion tons
(Excerpt) Read more at reuters.com ...

TOPICS: Business/Economy; China; News/Current Events
KEYWORDS: agw; china; chinacoal; climatechange; coal; coalproduction; electricity; energy; india




1
posted on 07/18/2024 7:12:22 AM PDT
by george76

[
Post Reply
 | Private Reply
 | View Replies]

To: george76

Without reliable, relatively cheap electricity modern life cannot exist. China will not invite poverty and political instability by embracing the anti fossil fuel agenda of the demented greens.

2
posted on 07/18/2024 7:21:14 AM PDT
by allendale

[
Post Reply
 | Private Reply
 | To 1
 | View Replies]

To: allendale

The largest importer of US coal is now India.
Last Friday I was at the BNSF mainline crossing in Athol, ID.
I had to wait while a coal train went by going west. I assume it was on its way to Tacoma from Wyoming.
Just to the east of there sat an empty hopper car train pointed east. Ready to go back to Wyoming and get reloaded.
The point is that US coal is still getting burned. The TOTAL use of coal WORLDWIDE is still increasing. Developing countries like India, China and others will continue to burn coal to drive their economies.
